title.narrative: Rice Mill for Rural Women Economic Empowerment

description.narrative: The women of Ibaji who are members of Kogi State Coalition Empowerment KWEC are bequeathed with a lot of shortcomings that have inhibited their progress in rice farming and production, hence are heavily struggling with sustaining an economically viable business venture. Accessibility to milling hubs is very difficult and expensive. Market for their product is poor and accessibility to it is quite tasking. Good storage facility for rice paddy and milled rice is not at their disposal hence high level of loss during rainy season. Processing of the paddy to a marketable finished product is not effective. About 30%/40% loss is incurred during parboiling of the paddy thus reducing the quantity of rice produced and the income that would have been generated. 10% to 20% of paddy is lost in transit to the distant location of local milling hubs, as they are conveyed in canoes along the Niger river. Following a result chain of rice movement from the farm to the mill, it has been observed that women face the risk of losing their product which arises as a result of movement through water ways to the milling center. At the mill, the poor processing method used ranging from per-boiling, drying and milling does not give local farmers the opportunity for competitive products in the open market leading to about 15% lose per farmer per production. Inappropriate weight measuring or scaling system is another hindrance to market prize. By setting up a properly equipped and functional mill with an effective management within a 5meter radius of the community, the struggles of these women will be reduced to the barest minimum. The mill will be equipped with: False bottom par-boiler, Dryer, Paddy cleaner, Hulling machine, Polisher, De-stoner, Digital scale and Bag sealers. An effective management will be recruited to administer and operate the mill.
